arguments.description: is used with the GPLOT procedure. Each legend value (not each symbol), is the width and height that you specify. For example, this specification produces legend values like the ones in (a):

arguments.name: SPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between individual legend values along a horizontal baseline.

arguments.name: SPLIT=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters that the LEGEND statement uses to break a text description string into multiple lines.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: modifies the legend value descriptions.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the legend label or legend value description text with respect to the horizontal. A positive value for degrees moves the text counterclockwise; a negative value moves it clockwise. By default, ANGLE=0 (horizontal).

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the text. If you omit the COLOR= option, a color specification is searched for in this order:

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the text. See for information about specifying fonts. If you omit the FONT= option, a font specification is searched for in this order:

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of the text characters in the number of units. By default, HEIGHT=1 CELL. If you omit the HEIGHT= option, a text height specification is searched for in this order:

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text. The default for character variables is JUSTIFY=LEFT. The default for numeric variables is JUSTIFY=RIGHT. Associating a character format with a numeric variable does not change the default justification of the variable.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: places the legend label in relation to the legend entries. The POSITION= option is used only with the LABEL= option. By default, POSITION=LEFT.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated with respect to the baseline of the text string. A positive value for degree rotates the character counterclockwise; a negative value moves it clockwise. By default, ROTATE=0 (parallel to the baseline).

arguments.name: TICK=
arguments.description: specifies the nth legend entry. The TICK= option is used only with the VALUE= option to designate the legend entry whose text and appearance you want to modify. For example, to change the text of the third legend entry to Minneapolis, specify the following code:

arguments.name: "text-string"
arguments.description: provides up to 256 characters of text for the value description. Enclose each string in quotation marks. Separate multiple strings with blanks. Value description text that is too long to fit in a legend area can result in the entire value not being displayed.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the value descriptions.

name: LIBNAME
description: Associates or disassociates a SAS library with a libref (a shortcut name), clears one or all librefs, lists the characteristics of a SAS library, concatenates SAS libraries, or concatenates SAS catalogs.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: is a shortcut name or a “nickname” for the aggregate storage location where your SAS files are stored. It is any SAS name when you are assigning a new libref. When you are disassociating a libref from a SAS library or when you are listing attributes, specify a libref that was previously assigned.

arguments.name: SAS-library
arguments.description: must be the physical name for the SAS library. The physical name is the name that is recognized by the operating environment. Enclose the physical name in single or double quotation marks.

arguments.name: library-specification
arguments.description: is two or more SAS libraries that are specified by physical names, previously assigned librefs, or a combination of the two. Separate each specification with either a blank or a comma and enclose the entire list in parentheses.

arguments.name: CLEAR
arguments.description: disassociates one or more currently assigned librefs.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: specifies that the CLEAR or LIST argument applies to all currently assigned librefs.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: writes the attributes of one or more SAS libraries to the SAS log.

arguments.name: READONLY
arguments.description: assigns a read-only attribute to an entire SAS library. SAS does not allow you to open a data set in the library in order to update information or write new information.

arguments.name: TEMP
arguments.description: specifies that the SAS library be treated as a scratch library. That is, the system does not consume CPU cycles to ensure that the files in a Temp library do not become corrupted.

arguments.name: AUTHADMIN=
arguments.description: specifies whether an administrator can access a metadata-bound library for which corresponding metadata is corrupted, misconfigured, or missing.

arguments.name: AUTHALTER=
arguments.description:
Specifies an ALTER password to use only in data access requests where both of these conditions exist:
• AUTHADMIN=YES is specified in the LIBNAME statement that is referenced in the request.
• The correct password for the target metadata-bound data set or library is not otherwise available or is invalid.

arguments.name: AUTHPW=
arguments.description:
Specifies a password to use only in data access requests where both of these conditions exist:
• AUTHADMIN=YES is specified in the LIBNAME statement that is referenced in the request or is invalid.
• The correct password for the target metadata-bound library is not otherwise available.

arguments.name: AUTHREAD=
arguments.description:
Specifies a READ password to use only in data access requests where both of these conditions exist:
• AUTHADMIN=YES is specified in the LIBNAME statement that is referenced in the request.
• The correct password for the target metadata-bound library is not otherwise available or is invalid.

arguments.name: AUTHWRITE=
arguments.description: Assigns a WRITE password to a metadata-bound library that prevents users from writing to a library, unless they enter the password.

arguments.name: COMPRESS=
arguments.description: controls the compression of observations in output SAS data sets for a SAS library.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the observations in a newly created SAS data set be uncompressed (fixed-length records).

arguments.name: CHAR
arguments.description: specifies that the observations in a newly created SAS data set be compressed (variable-length records) by SAS using RLE (Run Length Encoding). RLE compresses observations by reducing repeated consecutive characters (including blanks) to two-byte or three-byte representations.

arguments.name: BINARY
arguments.description: specifies that the observations in a newly created SAS data set be compressed (variable-length records) by SAS using RDC (Ross Data Compression). RDC combines run-length encoding and sliding-window compression to compress the file.

arguments.name: CVPBYTES=
arguments.description: specifies the number of bytes by which to expand character variable lengths when processing a SAS data file that requires transcoding. The CVP engine expands the lengths so that character data truncation does not occur. The lengths for character variables are increased by adding the specified value to the current length. You can specify a value from 0 to 32,766.

arguments.name: CVPENGINE=
arguments.description: specifies the engine to use to process a SAS data file that requires transcoding. The CVP engine expands the character variable lengths to transcoding so that character data truncation does not occur. Then the specified engine processes the actual file.

arguments.name: CVPFORMATWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies whether to expand the character format width.

arguments.name: CVPMULTIPLIER=
arguments.description: specifies a multiplier value that expands character variable lengths when you are processing a SAS data file that requires transcoding. The CVP engine expands the lengths so that character data truncation does not occur. The lengths for character variables are increased by multiplying the current length by the specified value. You can specify a multiplier value from 1 to 5 or you can specify 0 and then the CVP engine determines the multiplier automatically.

arguments.name: CVPVARCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies whether to convert fixed-width character variables to variable-width characters during input file processing. The byte length of the new-width character variable is the maximum number of bytes per character from the SAS session encoding multiplied by the specified fixed-width character length.

arguments.name: EXTENDOBSCOUNTER=
arguments.description: specifies whether to extend the maximum observation count in output SAS data files for a SAS library.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies to use the default maximum observation count of 263–1 or approximately 9.2 quintillion observations in a newly created SAS data file.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: is a compatibility setting for a newly created SAS data file, to enable its use in releases prior to SAS 9.3.

arguments.name: INENCODING=
arguments.description: overrides the encoding when you are reading (input processing) SAS data sets in the SAS library.

arguments.name: LIBRARYDEFINITION=
arguments.description: retrieves pre-defined engine LIBNAME information from the Data Sources microservice and performs a LIBNAME assignment using that information.

arguments.name: OUTENCODING=
arguments.description: OUTENCODING=ANY | ASCIIANY | EBCDICANY | encoding-value

arguments.name: OUTREP=
arguments.description:
specifies the data representation, which is the form in which data is stored in a particular operating environment. Different operating environments use different standards or conventions for storing data.
• Floating-point numbers can be represented in IEEE floating-point format or IBM floating-point format.
• Data alignment can be on a 1-byte, 4-byte, or 8-byte boundary, depending on data type requirements for the operating environment.
• Data type lengths can be 8 bits or more for a character data type, 16 bit, 32 bit, or 64 bit for an integer data type, 32 bit for a single-precision floating-point data type, and 64 bit for a double-precision floating-point data type.
• The ordering of bytes can be big Endian or little Endian.

arguments.name: POINTOBS=
arguments.description: specifies whether SAS creates compressed data sets whose observations can be randomly accessed or sequentially accessed.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: causes SAS software to produce a compressed data set that might be randomly accessed by observation number.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: suppresses the ability to randomly access observations in a compressed data set by observation number.

arguments.name: REPEMPTY=
arguments.description: controls replacement of SAS data sets when the new one is empty.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that a new empty data set replaces an existing data set. This is the default.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that a new empty data set does not replace an existing data set.

arguments.name: engine
arguments.description: is an engine name.

arguments.name: FILELOCKS=
arguments.description: specifies whether file locking is turned on or off for the files that are opened under the libref in the LIBNAME statement. The FILELOCKS statement option works like the FILELOCKS system option, except that it applies only to the files that are associated with the libref. The following values for the FILELOCKS statement option are available:

arguments.name: FILELOCKWAIT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of seconds SAS waits for a locked file to become available to another process.

arguments.name: ABAPFM=
arguments.description: Indicates the name of the ABAP function module that SAS uses.

arguments.name: ABAPPROG=
arguments.description: Indicates the name of the ABAP program that SAS uses.

arguments.name: ABAP_NAMESPACE=
arguments.description: Indicates the namespace for ABAP functions and programs that SAS uses.

arguments.name: ACCESS=
arguments.description: Determines the access level with which a libref connection is opened.

arguments.name: READONLY
arguments.description: specifies that you can read but not update tables and views.

arguments.name: ACCOUNT=
arguments.description: is an optional connection option that specifies the account number that you want to charge for the Teradata session.

arguments.name: ACLGRP=
arguments.description: Names an ACL group that has been previously assigned to the SPD Server user ID.

arguments.name: ACLSPECIAL=
arguments.description: Invokes special access to SPD Server resources in the server domain for a server user. The special privilege must already exist in the password database.

arguments.name: ADJUST_BYTE_SEMANTIC_COLUMN_LENGTHS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to adjust the lengths of CHAR or VARCHAR data type columns with byte semantic column lengths.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: indicates that column lengths are based on the number of characters multiplied by the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= value. When the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= value is greater than 1, ADJUST_BYTE_SEMANTIC_COLUMN_LENGTHS=YES.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: indicates that any column lengths that byte semantics specify on the server are used “as is” on the client. If DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=1, ADJUST_BYTE_SEMANTIC_COLUMN_LENGTHS=NO.

arguments.name: ADJUST_NCHAR_COLUMN_LENGTHS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to adjust the lengths of NCHAR or NVARCHAR data type columns.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: indicates that column lengths are based on the number of characters multiplied by the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= value.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: indicates that column lengths that NCHAR or NVARCHAR columns specify are multiplied by 2.

arguments.name: ALLOW_LARGE_RESULTS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to allow query results larger than the Google BigQuery maximum response size.

arguments.name: ALWAYS
arguments.description: specifies that all query results are written to a temporary stored table, including query results that are smaller than the maximum response size.

arguments.name: MUST
arguments.description: specifies that query results that are larger than the maximum response size are written to a temporary stored table.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that query results that are larger than the maximum response size trigger an error in the SAS log, and thus the query fails.

arguments.name: ALLOW_SELF_SIGNED_CERTS=
arguments.description: enables or disables SSL wire encryption of client requests.

arguments.name: ANALYZE=
arguments.description: Lets SAS improve performance when a single Hive store table is queried.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS might run an ANALYZE TABLE command to update table statistics. Current table statistics might improve SAS Read performance when a single table is queried. This operation is considered a hint, so if statistics are up-to-date, SAS might not perform the operation. The format of the ANALYZE TABLE command is subject to change in future releases of SAS as needed.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS does not perform an additional operation to update table statistics.

arguments.name: API_TRACE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to display the number of API calls that are made during a SAS session while connected to Salesforce.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies to display the number of API calls that are made in general during any operations that connect to Salesforce. It displays any SOQL statements that are executed in the database. As shown in the example below, it lets you view diagnostics on your SAS program in the SAS log.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the number of API calls is not displayed.

arguments.name: APPLICATIONNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the client application’s name for auditing purposes.

arguments.name: ASHOST=
arguments.description: Indicates the host name or IP address of a specific SAP application server.

arguments.name: AUTH=
arguments.description: specifies the authentication method that is used to access Microsoft Azure.

arguments.name: AUTHDOMAIN=
arguments.description: Enables connection to SPD Server by specifying the name of an authentication domain.

arguments.name: AUTHENDPOINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the authorization endpoint to use.

arguments.name: AUTHENDPOINT=
arguments.description: specifies a URL that represents the authorization endpoint to use to authenticate a user’s Salesforce account. If you are logging in to a production Salesforce instance, you do not need to specify this option. The default value is used.

arguments.name: AUTHSCOPE=
arguments.description: specifies the resources to use to authenticate to Microsoft Azure when using AUTH=OAUTH2.

arguments.name: AUTHTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies authentication to Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory) using single sign-on.

arguments.name: AUTOCOMMIT=
arguments.description: Indicates whether updates are committed immediately after they are submitted.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that all updates, deletes, and inserts are committed (that is, saved to a table) immediately after they are submitted, and no rollback is possible.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the SAS/ACCESS engine automatically performs the commit when it reaches the DBCOMMIT= value, or the default number of rows if DBCOMMIT= is not set.

arguments.name: AUTOMAP=
arguments.description: Specifies to automatically generate an XMLMap file to import an XML document.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: overwrites an existing XMLMap file.

arguments.name: REUSE
arguments.description: does not overwrite an existing XMLMap file.

arguments.name: BATCH=
arguments.description: Indicates whether SAS should use SAP batch jobs for data extracts.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: specifies that SAS uses batch jobs to extract R/3 data.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: specifies that SAS uses dialog processes to extract R/3 data.

arguments.name: BATCH_UPDATE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use batch update to write data to your external data source.

arguments.name: BIGQUERY
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the Google BigQuery interface.

arguments.name: BINARY_BYTE_LIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum length for binary columns that do not have a defined length.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is the maximum length for binary columns that do not have a defined length in the data source.

arguments.name: BLBYTES=
arguments.description: Modifies the size of the cached rowsets used in bulk loading.

arguments.name: BLCOMMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows that can be inserted before a bulk load commit occurs.

arguments.name: BLERRLIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of insertion errors that are allowed before bulk loading is terminated.

arguments.name: BLROWS=
arguments.description: Modifies the number of rows in the cached rowsets that are used in bulk loading.

arguments.name: BLSERVER=
arguments.description: Modifies the settings for server-side bulk loading.
arguments.help: BLSERVER= 0  | OFF | FALSE | NO | 1 | ON | TRUE | YES | *unsigned-integer*

arguments.name: BLWARNLIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of warning messages that are allowed before bulk loading is terminated.

arguments.name: BL_ACCOUNTNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the account to use on the external storage system.

arguments.name: account-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the account to use on the external storage system.

arguments.name: BL_APPLICATIONID=
arguments.description: Specifies the application ID (a GUID string) for accessing the external storage system.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies the Microsoft Entra Application ID (a GUID string) for accessing the external storage system.

arguments.name: BL_AWS_CONFIG_FILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the location of the AWS configuration file.

arguments.name: path-and-file-name
arguments.description: specifies the location of the AWS configuration file. By default, this location is ~/.aws/config.

arguments.name: BL_AWS_CREDENTIALS_FILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the path to the credentials file.

arguments.name: BL_AWS_PROFILE_NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the AWS profile to use when there is more than one profile in the AWS configuration file.

arguments.name: profile-name
arguments.description: specifies the profile to use if there is more than one profile in the AWS configuration file.

arguments.name: BL_AZURE_SAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the Azure shared access signature token value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the Azure shared access signature token value.

arguments.name: BL_BUCKET=
arguments.description: Specifies the bucket name to use when transferring data files in bulk.

arguments.name: BL_COMPRESS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to compress data files using the gzip format.

arguments.name: BL_CONFIG=
arguments.description: Specifies the location of the optional configuration file that the SAS communication layer uses to interact with the Amazon S3 tool.

arguments.name: path-and-file-name
arguments.description: specifies the host-specific directory path where the optional configuration file for communications with S3 is located.

arguments.name: BL_DEFAULT_DIR=
arguments.description: Specifies where bulk loading creates all intermediate files.

arguments.name: host-specific-directory-path
arguments.description: specifies the host-specific directory path where intermediate bulk-load files are created.

arguments.name: BL_DELETE_DATAFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to delete only the data file (NO) or all files that the SAS/ACCESS engine creates (YES) for the DBMS bulk-load facility.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: deletes all (data, control, and log) files that the SAS/ACCESS engine creates for the DBMS bulk-load facility.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: deletes only the data file after bulk loading.

arguments.name: BL_DELIMITER=
arguments.description: Specifies override of the default delimiter character for separating columns of data during bulk loading or unloading (retrieval).

arguments.name: BL_DNSSUFFIX=
arguments.description: Specifies the network host name where the storage system resides.

arguments.name: network-storage-host-name
arguments.description: specifies the network host name where the storage system resides. It is referred to as a suffix because the value is typically appended to the end of the storage account name.

arguments.name: BL_ENCKEY=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the encryption key to use when you access an Amazon S3 environment.

arguments.name: encryption-key-name
arguments.description: specifies the name that is associated with an encryption key. The name matches a name that was assigned to an encryption key by using the S3 procedure.

arguments.name: BL_FILESYSTEM=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the file system within the external storage system.

arguments.name: file-system-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the file system within the external storage system that files are to be read from and written to.

arguments.name: BL_FOLDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the folder or file path for the data in the external storage system.

arguments.name: file-path-and-folder
arguments.description: specifies the folder or file path for the data in the external storage system. The location path starts with the container name.

arguments.name: BL_FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the format of the bulk-load staging file.

arguments.name: CSV
arguments.description: specifies a comma-separated value (CSV) file format.

arguments.name: ORC
arguments.description: specifies the Apache ORC (Optimized Row Columnar) open-source file format.

arguments.name: PARQUET
arguments.description: specifies the Apache Parquet open-source file format.

arguments.name: TEXT
arguments.description: specifies plain text format. The delimiter is specified by the BL_DELIMITER= option.

arguments.name: BL_FORMAT_OPT=
arguments.description: Specifies formatting options for CSV files.

arguments.name: BL_HOST=
arguments.description: Specifies the WebHDFS host name or IP address of the server where the external data file is stored.

arguments.name: host-name
arguments.description: specifies the name or IP address of the server where the external data file is stored.

arguments.name: BL_IAM_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN=
arguments.description: Specifies an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role.

arguments.name: ARN-value
arguments.description: specifies an Amazon resource name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role. The associated IAM role enables you to get access credentials for S3 via the AssumeRole IAM operation.

arguments.name: BL_IAM_ASSUME_ROLE_NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies an AWS IAM role name that enables you to connect to an Amazon S3 environment.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies an AWS IAM role name that enables you to get access credentials for S3 via the AssumeRole IAM operation.

arguments.name: BL_IAM_ROLE=
arguments.description: Specifies an optional Amazon Web Services IAM role to use for the COPY command.

arguments.name: BL_IDENTITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the authentication method for the COPY command.

arguments.name: identity-value
arguments.description: specifies the authentication method for the COPY command in Azure Synapse Analytics (SQL DW).

arguments.name: BL_INFORMIXDIR=
arguments.description: Specifies the location of the Informix SDK installation.

arguments.name: directory-path
arguments.description: specifies the location of the Informix SDK installation.

arguments.name: BL_KEY=
arguments.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services access key that is used with key-based access control.

arguments.name: key-value
arguments.description: specifies an AWS key that you use to access the AWS environment.

arguments.name: BL_LOG=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the error file where all errors are written when BULKLOAD=YES.

arguments.name: file-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the designated log file.

arguments.name: BL_MAXERRORS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of rejected rows that are allowed in the load before the COPY command is canceled.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of rejected rows that are allowed in the load before the COPY command is canceled.

arguments.name: BL_NUM_DATAFILES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of data files to create to contain the source data.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the number of files to create to hold your source data. This value can be an integer between 1 and 100, inclusively.

arguments.name: BL_NUM_READ_THREADS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of threads to use for bulk unloading from the DBMS into SAS.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads that are used to perform bulk unloading (retrieval) of data from a DBMS.

arguments.name: BL_OPTIONS=
arguments.description: Passes to the DBMS bulk-load facility options that affect how it loads and processes data.

arguments.name: option
arguments.description: specifies a bulk-load option that you want to set.

arguments.name: BL_RECOVERABLE=
arguments.description: Determines whether the LOAD process is recoverable.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that the LOAD process is recoverable.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the LOAD process is not recoverable.

arguments.name: BL_REGION=
arguments.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services (AWS) region from which data is being retrieved.

arguments.name: region
arguments.description: specifies the AWS region from which S3 data is being loaded. You must specify the region when using the S3 tool to load data.

arguments.name: BL_SECRET=
arguments.description: Specifies the secret access key that is used when you transfer data in bulk.

arguments.name: secret-access-key
arguments.description: specifies the secret access key value to access a data source.

arguments.name: BL_TIMEOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum completion time for a storage task, in seconds.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the maximum completion time for a storage task, expressed as a number of seconds. If the task does not complete within the specified time, the storage system might return an error.

arguments.name: BL_TOKEN=
arguments.description: Specifies a temporary token that is associated with the temporary credentials that you specify with the BL_KEY= and BL_SECRET= options.

arguments.name: temporary-token
arguments.description: specifies a temporary token that is associated with the temporary credentials that you provide with BL_KEY= and BL_SECRET= LIBNAME options.

arguments.name: BL_USE_ESCAPE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to escape a predefined set of special characters during bulk loading or bulk retrieval.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that occurrences of a backslash (‘\’), newline (‘\n’), carriage return (‘\r’), or user-defined delimiter receives a backslash inserted before it. The backslash preserves these occurrences in the data file that is used for bulk loading or data retrieval. Any occurrence of the NULL character (0x00) is replaced by a space (‘ ’).

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that occurrences of a backslash (‘\’), newline (‘\n’), carriage return (‘\r’), or user-defined delimiter are not escaped in the data file that is used for the bulk loading or data retrieval.

arguments.name: BL_USE_LOG=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to get reports on rejected rows and the corresponding error file.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that a log that contains rejected rows and corresponding errors should be created during bulk loading. The log is stored in the location that is specified by the BL_LOG= option.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies not to create a bulk loading log.

arguments.name: BL_USE_PIPE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use a named pipe for data transfer.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that a named pipe is used to transfer data between SAS/ACCESS interfaces and the DBMS client interface.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that a flat file is used to transfer data. This setting enables you to save the file for later use or examination.

arguments.name: BL_USE_SSL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use TLS encryption for connections to Amazon S3.

arguments.name: BL_WRITEBUFF=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows to buffer in memory before writing to your data source.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows to hold in memory before writing to your data source.

arguments.name: BUFFER_SIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the minimum buffer size for data transfers in batch and dialog modes.

arguments.name: BUFFSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows of DBMS data to read into the buffer.

arguments.name: integer
arguments.description: the positive number of rows to hold in memory. SAS allows the maximum number that the DBMS allows.

arguments.name: BULKLOAD=
arguments.description: Determines whether SAS uses a data source utility to insert data into a data source table.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: calls a bulk-load utility that is specific to your data source to insert or append rows to a data source table.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: does not call the data source bulk-load utility.

arguments.name: BULKUNLOAD=
arguments.description: Rapidly retrieves (fetches) a large number of rows from an external data set.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: calls the Remote External Table interface to retrieve data from the server.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: uses standard result sets to retrieve data from the DBMS.

arguments.name: BULK_API=
arguments.description: Determines whether SAS uses the Salesforce Bulk API to insert and retrieve data from a Salesforce database.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: calls the Salesforce BULK API for query and load operations.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: calls the default Salesforce SOAP API for query and load operations.

arguments.name: BULK_REFRESH=
arguments.description: Specifies how often bulk load requests are checked for completion.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies in milliseconds how often bulk load requests are checked for completion.

arguments.name: BULK_TIMEOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the timeout period for bulk load operations.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the timeout period in milliseconds for bulk load operations. It applies to the entire duration of the bulk load, not for each API call.

arguments.name: BYSORT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use implicit automatic SPD Server sorts on BY clauses.

arguments.name: CAS
arguments.description: specifies the CAS LIBNAME engine.

arguments.name: CASLIB=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the caslib to use for engine operations in the LIBNAME statement.

arguments.name: CAST=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS or the Teradata DBMS server performs data conversions.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: forces data conversions (casting) to be done on the Teradata DBMS server and overrides any data overhead percentage limit.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: forces data conversions to be done by SAS and overrides any data overhead percentage limit.

arguments.name: CAST_OVERHEAD_MAXPERCENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the overhead limit for data conversions to perform in Teradata instead of SAS.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: any positive numeric value. The engine default is 20.

arguments.name: CDE
arguments.description: associates a SAS libref with data to be processed by Cloud Data Exchange for the SAS Viya platform.

arguments.name: CHARMULTIPLIER=
arguments.description: Expands column (variable) lengths by a multiplier value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the multiplier value to expand column (variable) lengths. These are column (variable) lengths specified in an XMLMap

arguments.name: CHAR_AS_NCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the default character type to use for table columns.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that NCHAR or NVARCHAR be used as the default column type.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that CHAR or VARCHAR be used as the default column type.

arguments.name: CHAR_COLUMN_LIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum length for character columns that do not have a defined length.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is the maximum length for character columns that do not have a defined length in the data source.

arguments.name: CHNGPASS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to prompt a server user for a change of password.

arguments.name: CLIENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAP logon parameter client.

arguments.name: CLIENT_ENCODING=
arguments.description: Specifies the encoding to use when transferring data from your DBMS.

arguments.name: encoding
arguments.description: specifies the encoding to use when transferring data into SAS.

arguments.name: CLIENT_ID=
arguments.description: Specifies the client ID value for the OAuth client that is used to connect to Google BigQuery using the OAuth authentication method.

arguments.name: ID-value
arguments.description: specifies the client ID value for the OAuth client that is used to connect to Google BigQuery using the OAuth authentication method.

arguments.name: CLIENT_SECRET=
arguments.description: Specifies the client secret value for the OAuth client that is used to connect to Google BigQuery using the OAuth authentication method.

arguments.name: authentication-secret
arguments.description: specifies the client secret value for the OAuth client that is used to connect to Google BigQuery using the OAuth authentication method.

arguments.name: COMPRESS=
arguments.description: Specifies to compress an SPD Engine data set on disk as it is being created.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: performs no data set compression.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that data in an SPD Engine data set be compressed in blocks by using RLE (run-length encoding). RLE compresses data by reducing repeated runs of the same character (including a blank space) to two-byte or three-byte representations.

arguments.name: BINARY
arguments.description: specifies that data in an SPD Engine data set be compressed in blocks by using RDC (Ross Data Compression). RDC combines RLE and sliding window compression to compress the file by representing repeated byte patterns more efficiently.

arguments.name: CONNECTION=
arguments.description: Specifies whether operations on single or multiple librefs can share a connection to the DBMS.
arguments.help: CONNECTION=   GLOBAL | GLOBALREAD | SHARED | SHAREDREAD | UNIQUE

arguments.name: GLOBAL
arguments.description: specifies that all operations that access DBMS tables in multiple librefs share a single connection if the conditions for sharing a connection are met. For more information, see .

arguments.name: GLOBALREAD
arguments.description: specifies that all READ operations that access DBMS tables in multiple librefs share a single connection if the conditions for sharing a connection are met. For more information, see .

arguments.name: SHARED
arguments.description: specifies that all operations that access DBMS tables in a single libref share a single connection if the conditions for sharing a connection are met. For more information, see .

arguments.name: SHAREDREAD
arguments.description: specifies that all READ operations that access DBMS tables in a single libref share a single connection if the conditions for sharing a connection are met. For more information, see .

arguments.name: UNIQUE
arguments.description: specifies that a separate connection is established every time a DBMS table is accessed by your SAS application.

arguments.name: CONNECTION_GROUP=
arguments.description: Causes operations on multiple librefs and on multiple SQL pass-through facility CONNECT statements to share a connection to the DBMS.

arguments.name: connection-group-name
arguments.description: name of a connection group.

arguments.name: CONOPTS=
arguments.description: specifies additional connection options for the Snowflake database. Separate multiple options with a semicolon.

arguments.name: CONTEXTROOT=
arguments.description: Specifies the context root to use in the HTTPS URL for an HTTP reverse proxy.

arguments.name: CRED_PATH=
arguments.description: specifies the location of a credential file that enables authentication to Google Cloud Platform.

arguments.name: CURSOR_TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the cursor type for read-only and updatable cursors.

arguments.name: DYNAMIC
arguments.description: specifies that the cursor reflects all changes that are made to the rows in a result set as you move the cursor. The data values and the membership of rows in the cursor can change dynamically on each fetch.

arguments.name: FORWARD_ONLY
arguments.description: specifies that the cursor functions like a DYNAMIC cursor except that it supports only sequential fetching of rows.

arguments.name: KEYSET_DRIVEN
arguments.description: specifies that the cursor determines which rows belong to the result set when the cursor is opened. However, changes that are made to these rows are reflected as you scroll around the cursor.

arguments.name: STATIC
arguments.description: specifies that the cursor builds the complete result set when the cursor is opened. No changes that are made to the rows in the result set after the cursor is opened are reflected in the cursor. Static cursors are read-only.

arguments.name: CVP
arguments.description: specifies the character variable padding (CVP) engine to expand character variable lengths so that character data truncation does not occur when a file requires transcoding.

arguments.name: DATABASE=
arguments.description: specifies the default database to use for sessions that the driver initiates and that contains the tables and views that you want to access. If the database name contains spaces or nonalphanumeric characters, you must enclose it in quotation marks.

arguments.name: DATALIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of bytes of data that can be transferred between the CAS server and SAS during a single-table read.

arguments.name: DATAPATH=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of paths in which to store data partitions (.dpf) for an SPD Engine data set.

arguments.name: 'path'
arguments.description: is a complete pathname in single or double quotation marks within parentheses. Separate multiple arguments with spaces.

arguments.name: DATASRC=
arguments.description: specifies the configured ODBC data source to which you want to connect.

arguments.name: DATA_BLOCK_SIZE
arguments.description: Requests a stripe size for an ORC table during creation (output).

arguments.name: DB2
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the DB2 interface.

arguments.name: DBCLIENT_ENCODING_FIXED=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS session encoding is a fixed width.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: indicates that database table column lengths in characters are a fixed width. Use this value to adjust byte lengths within SAS for any database column lengths that are specified in bytes. The number of characters is calculated as the length that is specified in SAS, divided by the value in DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=. If needed, and if DB_LENGTH_SEMANTIC_BYTE=YES, the character length is then multiplied by the value in DBSERVER_MAX_BYTES=.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: indicates that database table column lengths are not a fixed width.

arguments.name: DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of bytes per single character in SAS session encoding when reading character data from a DBMS.

arguments.name: maximum-client-bytes
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of bytes to apply for storage of CHAR and NCHAR variables for client encoding.

arguments.name: DBCOMMIT=
arguments.description: Causes an automatic COMMIT (permanently writing data to the DBMS) after processing a specified number of rows.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows that are processed. This value must be an integer greater than or equal to 0.

arguments.name: DBCONINIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined initialization command to execute immediately after every connection to the DBMS that is within the scope of the LIBNAME statement or libref.

arguments.name: DBMS-user-command
arguments.description: any valid command that the SAS/ACCESS engine can execute and that does not return a result set or output parameters.

arguments.name: DBCONTERM=
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined termination command to execute before every disconnect from the DBMS that is within the scope of the LIBNAME statement or libref.

arguments.name: DBMS-user-command
arguments.description: any valid command that the SAS/ACCESS engine can execute and that does not return a result set or output parameters.

arguments.name: DBCREATE_TABLE_EXTERNAL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether a Hive table is created and stored in the Hive warehouse or external to the Hive warehouse.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: creates an external table—one that is stored outside of the Hive warehouse.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: creates a managed table—one that is managed within the Hive warehouse.

arguments.name: DBCREATE_TABLE_LOCATION=
arguments.description: Specifies the default location for external tables.

arguments.name: DBCREATE_TABLE_OPTS=
arguments.description: Specifies DBMS-specific syntax to add to the CREATE TABLE statement.

arguments.name: DBMS-SQL-clauses
arguments.description: specifies one or more DBMS-specific clauses that can be appended to the end of a SQL CREATE TABLE statement.

arguments.name: DBDATASRC=
arguments.description: is an environment variable that lets you specify a default data source. This value is used if you do not specify a DSN= connection option.

arguments.name: DBGEN_NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the method that SAS uses to rename any DBMS columns that contain characters that SAS does not allow.

arguments.name: DBMS
arguments.description: specifies that SAS renames DBMS columns to valid SAS variable names. SAS converts to underscores any characters that it does not allow. If it converts a column to a name that already exists, it appends a sequence number at the end of the new name.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: specifies that SAS converts DBMS columns that contain characters that SAS does not allow into valid SAS variable names. SAS uses the format _COLn, where n is the column number, starting with 0. If SAS converts a name to a name that already exists, it appends a sequence number at the end of the new name.

arguments.name: DBINDEX=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS uses columns that have specified DBMS indexes when processing a join.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS uses columns that have specified DBMS indexes in the WHERE clause.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS does not use indexes that are specified on DBMS columns.

arguments.name: DBLIBINIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined initialization command to execute once within the scope of the LIBNAME statement or libref that established the first connection to the DBMS.

arguments.name: DBMS-user-command
arguments.description: any DBMS command that the SAS/ACCESS engine can execute and that does not return a result set or output parameters.

arguments.name: DBLIBTERM=
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined termination command to execute once, before the DBMS that is associated with the first connection made by the LIBNAME statement or libref disconnects.

arguments.name: DBMS-user-command
arguments.description: any DBMS command that can be executed by the SAS/ACCESS engine and that does not return a result set or output parameters.

arguments.name: DBLINK=
arguments.description: For Oracle, this option specifies a link from your local database to database objects on another server. For SAP ASE, this option specifies a link from the default database to another database on the server to which you are connected.

arguments.name: DBMAX_TEXT=
arguments.description: Determines the length of any very long DBMS character data type, such as BLOB or CLOB, that is read into SAS or written from SAS when using a SAS/ACCESS engine.

arguments.name: integer
arguments.description: an integer between 1 and 32,767.

arguments.name: DBMAX_TEXT_TYPES=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the DBMAX_TEXT= LIBNAME option is applied to all character types or only "long" data types.

arguments.name: DBMSTEMP=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS creates temporary tables.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS creates one or more temporary tables.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS creates permanent tables.

arguments.name: DBNULL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether NULL is a valid value for the specified columns when a table is created.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that the NULL value is valid for the specified columns in the DBMS table.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the NULL value is not valid for the specified columns in the DBMS table.

arguments.name: DBNULLKEYS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether Null values are allowed in key columns.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that NULL values are allowed in key columns in a transaction table or a primary table.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that NULL values are not allowed in key columns for a transaction table or a primary table.

arguments.name: DBNULLWHERE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether character columns in a WHERE clause can contain NULL values.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that there might be a NULL value for a column that is listed in a WHERE clause.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that none of the columns in a WHERE clause contain NULL values.

arguments.name: DBPROMPT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS displays a window that prompts the user to enter DBMS connection information before connecting to the DBMS in interactive mode.

arguments.name: DBSASLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the column labels an engine uses.

arguments.name: COMPAT
arguments.description: specifies that the labels returned should be compatible with what the application normally receives—meaning that engines exhibit their normal behavior.

arguments.name: DBMS
arguments.description: specifies that the engine returns a label exactly as it is stored in the database.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that the engine does not return a column label. The engine returns blanks for the column labels.

arguments.name: DBSERVER_ENCODING_FIXED=
arguments.description: Specifies whether Oracle database encoding is a fixed width.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: indicates that database table column lengths in characters are a fixed width. Use this value to adjust byte lengths within SAS for any database column lengths that are specified in bytes. The number of characters is calculated by dividing the byte length by the value in DBSERVER_MAX_BYTES=.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: indicates that database table column lengths are not a fixed width.

arguments.name: DBSERVER_MAX_BYTES=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of bytes per single character in the database server encoding.

arguments.name: DBSLICEPARM=
arguments.description: Controls the scope of DBMS threaded Reads and the number of threads.
arguments.help:
DBSLICEPARM= NONE | THREADED_APPS | ALL\nDBSLICEPARM=  ( NONE | THREADED_APPS | ALL
            <max-threads>             )\nDBSLICEPARM=  (             NONE | THREADED_APPS | ALL<, max-threads>             )

arguments.name: NONETHREADED_APPSALL
arguments.description: specifies how to manage threaded Reads from your data source.

arguments.name: DB_LENGTH_SEMANTICS_BYTE=
arguments.description: Indicates whether CHAR and VARCHAR2 column lengths are specified in bytes or characters when creating an Oracle table.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that CHAR and VARCHAR2 column lengths are specified in bytes when creating an Oracle table. The byte length is derived by multiplying the number of characters in SAS with DBSERVER_MAX_BYTES= value.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that CHAR and VARCHAR2 column lengths are specified in characters when creating an Oracle table. The CHAR keyword is also added next to the length value to indicate that this is the character (not byte) length. For fixed-width encoding, the number of characters is derived by dividing the byte length in SAS for the variable by the value in DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=. For variable-width encoding, the number of characters remains the same as the number of bytes.

arguments.name: DB_OBJECTS=
arguments.description: Specifies which database objects to return with PROC DATASETS or in SAS Explorer.
arguments.help: DB_OBJECTS= TABLES |   VIEWS |  SYNONYMS |  PUBLIC_SYNONYMS | ALL

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: returns all database object names, which can slow performance. Specify ALL by itself. It always overrides any multiple values that you specify.

arguments.name: PUBLIC_SYNONYMS
arguments.description: returns only public database synonym names.

arguments.name: SYNONYMS
arguments.description: returns only database synonym names.

arguments.name: TABLES
arguments.description: returns only database table names.

arguments.name: VIEWS
arguments.description: returns only database view names.

arguments.name: DEFAULT_AUTH_PLUGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the authentication plugin to use for a connection to a data source.

arguments.name: caching_sha2_passwordmysql_native_password
arguments.description: specifies the authentication plugin to use for a connection to a data source.

arguments.name: DEFER=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to defer the connection to the data source.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that the connection to the DBMS occurs when a table in the DBMS is opened.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the connection to the DBMS occurs when the libref is assigned by a LIBNAME statement.

arguments.name: DELETE_MULT_ROWS=
arguments.description: Indicates whether to let SAS delete multiple rows from a data source, such as a DBMS table.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS processing continues if multiple rows are deleted. This might produce unexpected results.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS processing does not continue if multiple rows are deleted.

arguments.name: DERIVECHARMULTIPLIER=
arguments.description: Expands column (variable) lengths by a default multiplier value that is based on the session encoding.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: expands column (variable) lengths by a default multiplier value that is based on the session encoding. These are column (variable) lengths specified in an XMLMap

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: does not expand column (variable) lengths.

arguments.name: DESTGROUP=
arguments.description: Indicates the name of the destination group for batch access to the SAP system when the SAP LIBNAME engine uses direct RFC calls.

arguments.name: DESTINATION=
arguments.description: Indicates the destination in the saprfc.ini file if you are working with an saprfc.ini file.

arguments.name: DIRECTORIES_AS_DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies whether file system directories are used as tables.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that directories in the library location are accessed as tables.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that directories in the library location are not accessed as tables.

arguments.name: DIRECT_EXE=
arguments.description: Allows you to pass a SAS SQL procedure DELETE statement directly to a data source to process, which can improve performance.

arguments.name: DIRECT_SQL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether generated SQL is passed to the DBMS for processing.
arguments.help:
DIRECT_SQL= NO | 
               NOFUNCTIONS | 
               NOGENSQL | NOMULTOUTJOINS | NONE | NOWHERE | YES

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that generated SQL from PROC SQL is not passed to the DBMS for processing. This is the same as specifying the value NOGENSQL.

arguments.name: NOFUNCTIONS
arguments.description: prevents SQL statements from being passed to the DBMS for processing when they contain functions.

arguments.name: NOGENSQL
arguments.description: prevents PROC SQL from generating SQL to be passed to the DBMS for processing.

arguments.name: NOMULTOUTJOINS
arguments.description: specifies that PROC SQL does not attempt to pass any multiple outer joins to the DBMS for processing. Other join statements might be passed down, however, including portions of a multiple outer join.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that generated SQL is not passed to the DBMS for processing. This includes SQL that is generated from PROC SQL, SAS functions that can be converted into DBMS functions, joins, and WHERE clauses.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that generated SQL from PROC SQL is passed directly to the DBMS for processing.

arguments.name: DISCONNECT=
arguments.description: Controls how user proxy resources are assigned for a server user.

arguments.name: DM_UNICODE=
arguments.description: Specifies the Unicode encoding for your driver manager.

arguments.name: DRIVER=
arguments.description: specifies the ODBC driver.

arguments.name: DRIVERCLASS=
arguments.description: specifies the class name of the JDBC driver that is used to connect to Databricks or Spark. DRIVERCLASS= is required only if you want to use a JDBC driver other than the ones that are redistributed by SAS.

arguments.name: DRIVER_TRACE=
arguments.description: Requests tracing information that logs transaction records to an external file.

arguments.name: tracing-level
arguments.description: specifies the level of information that is recorded in the log file.

arguments.name: DRIVER_TRACEFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the trace log.

arguments.name: path-and-filename
arguments.description: specifies the path and file name for the trace log. Include the path and file name within single or double quotation marks.

arguments.name: DRIVER_TRACEOPTIONS=
arguments.description: Specifies options for the trace log file.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies options to control formatting and other properties for the trace log.

arguments.name: DSN=
arguments.description: specifies the configured ODBC data source to which you want to connect.

arguments.name: ENABLE_BULK=
arguments.description: Lets the connection process bulk copy when loading data into an SAP ASE table.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: disables bulk copy ability for the libref.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: lets the connection perform bulk copy of SAS data into SAP ASE.

arguments.name: ENABLE_CLEARTEXTPLUGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to enable the Cleartext plug-in for authentication.

arguments.name: YESNO
arguments.description: specifies whether to enable the Cleartext plug-in for authentication.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies how communication is encrypted.

arguments.name: ENDOBS=
arguments.description: Specifies the end row number in a user-defined range for processing.

arguments.name: ERRLIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of errors that are allowed while using the TPT or Fastload utility before SAS stops loading data to Teradata.

arguments.name: integer
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer that represents the number of errors after which SAS stops loading data.

arguments.name: ESCAPE_BACKSLASH=
arguments.description: Specifies whether backslashes in literals are preserved during data copy from a SAS data set to a table.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that an additional backslash is inserted in every literal value that already contains a backslash.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that backslashes that exist in literal values are not preserved. An error results.

arguments.name: FASTEXPORT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the SAS/ACCESS engine uses the TPT API to read data.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that data is loaded from Teradata into SAS using the TPT Export driver.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the TPT Export driver is not to be used.

arguments.name: FEDSVR
arguments.description: specifies the engine that connects to SAS Federation Server. The engine establishes a remote connection, such that the current SAS session is a client to SAS Federation Server.

arguments.name: FETCH_IDENTITY=
arguments.description: Returns the value of the last inserted identity value.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: returns the value of the last inserted identity value.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: disables this option.

arguments.name: FETCH_NUMERIC_TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies how to load NUMERIC data from Google BigQuery.

arguments.name: FILE_NAME_EXTENSION=
arguments.description: Specifies nondefault file extensions for SAS to read and write files.

arguments.name: extension-type
arguments.description: is one extension or a list of extensions. Do not include the period (.) character in an extension.

arguments.name: _NONE_
arguments.description: specifies that files that have no extension are valid. You can specify the _NONE_ keyword alone or in a list of extensions. If you specify a list of extensions, place the _NONE_ keyword in the desired order of precedence.

arguments.name: FORMATACTIVE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS formats are used.

arguments.name: FORMATLIBRARY=
arguments.description: Specifies the libref of an existing SAS library in which to create the format catalog.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the libref of an existing SAS library in which to create the format catalog.

arguments.name: FORMATNOREPLACE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to replace existing format entries in the format catalog search path in cases where an existing format entry has the same name as a format that is being created by the XML engine when it converts a CDISC ODM CodeList element.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: does not replace formats that have the same name.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: does replace formats that have the same name.

arguments.name: GO_ENABLE_LOGGING=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to enable logging in the Go layer.

arguments.name: GO_LOG_FILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the file that contains log information from the Go layer.

arguments.name: GO_LOG_FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the format for trace messages in Go layer logging.
arguments.help: GO_LOG_FORMAT= json | pretty | term | file | plain | message | logfmt

arguments.name: json
arguments.description: specifies single-line, compact JSON.

arguments.name: pretty
arguments.description: specifies multi-line, indented JSON.

arguments.name: term
arguments.description: specifies color terminal output

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: specifies *.log file style output.

arguments.name: plain
arguments.description: specifies simple level and message format.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: specifies message string only.

arguments.name: logfmt
arguments.description: specifies structured logging of key-value pairs.

arguments.name: GO_LOG_LEVEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the logging level for Go layer logging.
arguments.help: GO_LOG_LEVEL= ERROR | WARN | INFO | DEBUG | TRACE

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: indicates that errors have occurred.

arguments.name: WARN
arguments.description: provides messages that identify potentially harmful situations.

arguments.name: INFO
arguments.description: provides information that highlights the progress of an application.

arguments.name: DEBUG
arguments.description: provides detailed information that you can use to debug your application.

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: produces the most detailed information about your application.

arguments.name: GREENPLM
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the Greenplum interface.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: Indicates the name of the group of SAP application servers if you are using load balancing.

arguments.name: GWHOST=
arguments.description: Indicates the host name of the SAP gateway.

arguments.name: GWSERV=
arguments.description: Indicates the service of the SAP gateway.

arguments.name: HADOOP
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the Hadoop interface.

arguments.name: HDFS_DATADIR=
arguments.description: when option HDFS_METADIR= is specified, specifies the path to the Spark directory where SAS reads and writes data (for example, ‘/sas/hpa’). This option is valid only when SAS is configured with access to HDFS.

arguments.name: HDFS_METADIR=
arguments.description: specifies the path to an HDFS directory that contains XML-based table definitions. Through these descriptors, SAS then accesses the data using HDFS instead of Spark. If you want the Spark engine to connect to Spark SQL, do not specify this option.

arguments.name: HDFS_TEMPDIR=
arguments.description: specifies the path to the HDFS directory where SAS reads and writes temporary data.

arguments.name: HIDEFLAGS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the columns Questionable, Annotated, and Substituted are hidden.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: hides the Questionable, Annotated, and Substituted columns.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: displays all columns.

arguments.name: HIDEOPTVARS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to hide the secondary variables of a data set.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies to exclude nonessential variables in the data set. For more information about which variables are hidden when HIDEOPTVARS=YES, see .

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies not to exclude the secondary variables of a data set. To display all of the variables in a data set, specify HIDEOPTVARS=NO.

arguments.name: HIVE_PRINCIPAL=
arguments.description: specifies the principal name of the Hive server in an environment that uses Kerberos.

arguments.name: HTTPPATH=
arguments.description: specifies the HTTP or HTTPS endpoint for building the JDBC URL connection string. This option is ignored when the URL= option is specified.

arguments.name: IDXBY=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use an index when processing a BY statement in the SPD Engine.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: uses an index when processing indexed variables in a BY statement.

arguments.name: IEEE_REVERSE=
arguments.description: Indicates whether floating-point numbers are byte-reversed.

arguments.name: IGNORE_BASELINE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to try the connection regardless of the minimum required Hadoop version.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: Specifies that SAS allows connections to a target DBMS that does not meet minimum requirements. Although using this option is not recommended, it might be useful when version information is reported incorrectly or in test environments.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: Specifies that SAS rejects connections to a target DBMS that does not meet minimum requirements and issues an error to the SAS log.

arguments.name: IGNORE_FEDSQL_OBJECTS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to ignore FedSQL objects in a library query.

arguments.name: YESNO
arguments.description: specifies whether to ignore FedSQL objects, such as FedSQL views, DS2 packages, or DS2 threads.

arguments.name: IGNORE_READ_ONLY_COLUMNS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to ignore or include columns where data types are read-only when generating a SQL statement for inserts or updates.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that the SAS/ACCESS engine ignores columns where data types are read-only when you are generating insert and update SQL statements.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the SAS/ACCESS engine does not ignore columns where data types are read-only when you are generating insert and update SQL statements.

arguments.name: IMPALA
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the Impala interface.

arguments.name: IN=
arguments.description: Lets you specify the database and tablespace in which you want to create a new table.

arguments.name: database-name.tablespace-name
arguments.description: specifies the names of the database and tablespace, which are separated by a period. Enclose the entire specification in single quotation marks.

arguments.name: DATABASE
arguments.description: specifies only the database name. Specify the word DATABASE, a space, and the database name. Enclose the entire specification in single quotation marks.

arguments.name: INDENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns to indent each nested element in the exported XML document.

arguments.name: integer
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns to indent each nested element in the exported XML document.

arguments.name: INDEXPATH=
arguments.description: Specifies a path or list of paths in which to store the two types of index component files (.hbx and .idx) associated with an SPD Engine data set.

arguments.name: 'path'
arguments.description: is a complete pathname, in single or double quotation marks within parentheses. Separate multiple arguments with spaces.

arguments.name: INENCODING=
arguments.description: Overrides and changes the encoding when reading or writing Base SAS data sets in the SAS library.

arguments.name: INFORMIX
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the Informix interface.

arguments.name: INITCMD=
arguments.description: Causes an automatic COMMIT (permanently writing data to the DBMS) after processing a specified number of rows.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows that are processed. This value must be an integer greater than or equal to 0.

arguments.name: INSERTBUFF=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows in a single DBMS insert.

arguments.name: positive-integer
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows to insert.

arguments.name: INSERT_SQL=
arguments.description: Determines the method to use to insert rows into a data source.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS uses the SQL insert method for the data source to insert new rows into a table.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS uses an alternate, DBMS-specific method to insert new rows into a table.

arguments.name: INSTANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the instance number of the SAP HANA database engine. The port number is 3<instance-number>15 (for example, 30015 for the instance number 00). If you specify the port number explicitly in either PORT= or SERVER=, then INSTANCE= is ignored and a warning is written to the SAS log.

arguments.name: INTERFACE=
arguments.description: specifies the name and location of the SAP ASE interfaces file. This file contains the names and network addresses of all available servers on the network. If you omit this statement, the default action for your operating system occurs. INTERFACE= is not used in some operating environments. Contact your database administrator to determine whether it applies to your operating environment.

arguments.name: IOBLOCKSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the size in bytes of a block of observations to be used in an I/O operation.

arguments.name: IP=
arguments.description: Invokes SQL implicit pass-through processing for the SPD Server session.

arguments.name: IP_CURSOR=
arguments.description: specifies whether implicit PROC SQL pass-through processes multiple result data sets simultaneously. IP_CURSOR is set to NO by default. Setting it to YES allows this type of extended processing. However, it decreases performance because cursors, not result data sets, are being used. Do not set to YES unless needed.

arguments.name: JDBC
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the JDBC interface.

arguments.name: JMP
arguments.description: specifies the engine that connects to a JMP data table.

arguments.name: JSON
arguments.description: provides read-only sequential access to JSON data.

arguments.name: KEYSET_SIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows that are keyset driven.

arguments.name: number-of-rows
arguments.description: an integer with a value between 0 and the number of rows in the cursor.

arguments.name: LANGUAGE=
arguments.description: Indicates the SAP logon parameter language.

arguments.name: LARGE_RESULTS_DATASET=
arguments.description: Specifies a data set ID for query results.

arguments.name: Google-BigQuery-data-set-ID
arguments.description: specifies a data set ID to which result set tables are written.

arguments.name: LARGE_RESULTS_EXPIRATION_TIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the amount of time in milliseconds until a temporary table is deleted.

arguments.name: milliseconds
arguments.description: specifies the amount of time in milliseconds before a temporary table is deleted.

arguments.name: LARGE_RESULTS_PROJECT=
arguments.description: Specifies a project ID for large query results.

arguments.name: project-name
arguments.description: specifies a project ID for large query results.

arguments.name: LIBGEN=
arguments.description: Configures the SPD Server connection to generate additional domain connections.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: writes the attributes of one or more SAS libraries to the SAS log.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: Specifies the localization that was used to store data.

arguments.name: location
arguments.description: specifies the location, from a localization standpoint, in which a data set is stored.

arguments.name: LOCKING=
arguments.description: Enables record-level locking for the domain.

arguments.name: LOCKTABLE=
arguments.description: Places exclusive or shared locks on tables.

arguments.name: EXCLUSIVE
arguments.description: specifies that other users are prevented from accessing each table that you open in the libref.

arguments.name: SHARE
arguments.description: specifies that other users or processes can read data from the tables, but they cannot update the data.

arguments.name: LOCKTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait until rows are available for locking.

arguments.name: LOCKWAIT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to wait indefinitely until rows are available for locking.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that SAS waits until rows are available for locking.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that SAS does not wait and returns an error to indicate that the lock is not available.

arguments.name: LOGDB=
arguments.description: Redirects to an alternate database-specific table that FastExport creates or MultiLoad uses.

arguments.name: database-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the Teradata database.

arguments.name: LOGIN_TIMEOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the default login time-out for connecting to and accessing data sources in a library.

arguments.name: numeric-value
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer for the number of seconds to wait for the connection. A value of 0 indicates to wait indefinitely.

arguments.name: MAPREDUCE_JOB_NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the MapReduce job name.

arguments.name: MAPREDUCE_QUEUE_NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the MapReduce queue name.

arguments.name: MAXTABLEMEM=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, to allocate for an in-memory table.

arguments.name: MAX_BINARY_LEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum length in bytes of a binary column.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the maximum length in bytes of a binary column. The value that you specify must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: MAX_CHAR_LEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters to allocate for Google BigQuery string columns.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of characters to allocate for string columns.

arguments.name: MAX_CONNECTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of simultaneous connections that SAP ASE allows.

arguments.name: MAX_STRING_SIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to override string limits that are returned via Oracle.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS uses the MAX_STRING_SIZE value that is returned when Oracle is queried.

arguments.name: EXTENDED
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS uses length limits for character values that correspond to those that Oracle uses when the MAX_STRING_SIZE parameter is set to EXTENDED.

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/ACCESS uses length limits for character values that correspond to those that Oracle uses when the MAX_STRING_SIZE parameter is set to STANDARD.

arguments.name: MAX_TABLE_JOINS
arguments.description: Indicates the number of tables that you can use in a left-outer join or an inner join in ABAP Open SQL.

arguments.name: METAPATH=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of paths in which to store overflow metadata (.mdf) component files for an SPD Engine data set.

arguments.name: 'path'
arguments.description: is a complete pathname in single or double quotation marks within parentheses. Separate multiple arguments with spaces.

arguments.name: MODE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the connection to Teradata uses the ANSI or Teradata mode.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCE
arguments.description: specifies that you want to enable several performance-related options.

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: specifies that you want to use default values for performance-related options.

arguments.name: MONGO
arguments.description: specifies the SAS/ACCESS engine name for the MongoDB interface.

arguments.name: MONGO_PLATFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of database server to use for the MongoDB connection.

arguments.name: ATLAS
arguments.description: specifies to connect to MongoDB services on MongoDB Atlas. MongoDB Atlas provides cloud-hosted MongoDB services on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud.

arguments.name: NATIVE
arguments.description: specifies to connect to a local MongoDB database server.

arguments.name: MSHOST=
arguments.description: Indicates the host name of the message server, if you are using load balancing.

arguments.name: MULTISTMT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether insert statements are sent to Teradata one at a time or in a group.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: use TPT stream processing and use the maximum buffer size available for the Teradata Client TTU version and the Teradata DBS version that is being accessed.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: send inserts to Teradata one row at a time.

arguments.name: MULTI_DATASRC_OPT=
arguments.description: Used in place of DBKEY to improve performance when processing a join between two data sources.

arguments.name: IN_CLAUSE
